The SIC codes can be grouped into progressively broader industry classifications: industry group, major group, and division. The first 3 digits of the SIC code indicate the industry group, and the first two digits indicate the major group. The value of the field (the date difference) is to be displayed in the format Years Months Days. INSERT INTO ui.EnDtFieldDescription(ContextName, DataKey, BusinessDescription, FieldBehaviour, ComponentUniqueName) VALUES ( N'completeRiskAssessmentBRE-Individual', N'LengthOfLERelantionship_Text', N'the length of the relationship the LE has with the bank', N'Value to be a date difference between current date and date of completion of Review & Approve task for the on-boarding workflow (either CoB or AoB). The date-difference is then to be compared to a separate threshold set (Less than 1 year, 1-5 years, greater than 5 years) with the resultant risk value for this risk factor being either a 3, 2, or 1 respectively. The value of the field (the date difference) is to be displayed in the format Years Months Days. For the on-boarding workflows this will be an automatic 3 (high) as the date difference will not be calculable as the Review & Approve task will not have been completed as it is at the end of the workflow, resulting in zeros being displayed.', NULL);

Controlling Person means a natural person who exercises direct or indirect control over an entity. In regard to corporates, a Controlling Person is one who has an ownership interest of more than 25% in the company. If a partnership, the Controlling Persons include any individual with a 25% or greater interest in the profits or capital of the partnership. In the case of trusts the controlling persons could include the settlor, trustees, any beneficiaries in receipt of distributions and the protector if he/she has the power to remove the trustees. **Note these should be split out as the substantial person is a lower threshold of 10%', N'This field effects Validation Rules. A member or associated person shall use reasonable diligence to obtain and analyze all of the factors delineated in Rule 2111(a) unless the member or associated person has a reasonable basis to believe, documented with specificity, that one or more of the factors are not relevant components of a customer''s investment profile in light of the facts and circumstances of the particular case.', N'', NULL);
